Some people do run low on their temperture naturally. So, I don't know it is a problem. Your Amylase could be high due to the UTI, some UTI's affect the kidneys and this would raise your Amylase. Did you have a high Amylase before the UTI or during? I would retest after the UTI clears. The stomach pain is another matter. If your amylase and lipase are still high after the infection you should see your doctor about the stomach pain. It could be pancreatitis.

You don't mention yoor age, but older people (over 65) typically run a low temperature when it is cold, as the autonomic nervous system loses the ability to stable their body temperature.If you are in the older age range, I wouldn't   think twice about the temp.In the unusualy case of autonomic dysfunction, some people do have abdominal  pain (like severe gas) as the autonomic system also controls the stomache.
